en.Title: Grow Hop
en.GameOver: Would you like to continue playing for another day?
en.Intro2a: This is a game about how plants grow.
en.Intro3a: In the game, you’ll play as a plant in a pot, which has mysteriously become able to run and jump.
en.Intro3b: The goal is to grow as tall as you can, using everything that you’ve learned.
en.Intro4a: Unlike animals, plants can’t eat or digest, because they don’t have mouths, teeth, or stomachs.
en.Intro5b: They do this through the process of photosynthesis.
en.Intro6a: During photosynthesis, plants absorb energy from sunlight through their leaves to turn water and carbon dioxide into oxygen and sugar.
en.Intro6b: The sugar that a plant produces during photosynthesis is food for the plant.
en.Intro7a: Sugar, like all food, contains energy that can be released and used when it is consumed.
en.Intro7b: Plants use the energy from their sugar to stay healthy and grow.
en.Sun1b: It shows you how much sunlight is falling on you right now.
en.Sun2a: On the meter, green is good for photosynthesis and red is bad for photosynthesis.
en.Sun2b: So always try to stay in the green zone, or as close to it as possible.
en.Sun3a: Now jump down off the balcony and into the direct sunlight.
en.Sun4b: Your sunlight is now at an excellent level for photosynthesis.
en.Controls2b: Touch / click wherever you want to move toward:
en.Water1a: Sunlight alone is not enough for photosynthesis.
en.Water2b: It shows you how much water is available for photosynthesis.
en.Water3a: Unlike sunlight, more water is not always better.
en.Water3b: Having too much water in the soil will drown your roots.
en.Water4a: Try to keep the water meter in the green zone!
en.Water5a: Your water is low. Go collect some rain, but not too much!
en.Water6b: But it won’t last forever: you will gradually lose water!
en.Water7b: a) sunlight level is high (more water is evaporated from the soil)
en.Water7c: b) photosynthesis rate is high (more water + carbon dioxide transformed into sugar + oxygen)
en.Photo1b: It shows your current photosynthesis rate (how quickly sunlight + water + carbon dioxide are being transformed into sugar + oxygen).
en.Photo2a: Photosynthesis requires the presence of light, water, and carbon dioxide.
en.Photo2b: If you remove any one of these, then photosynthesis will be impossible.
en.Photo3a: However, there will be plenty of carbon dioxide wherever you go, so don’t worry about collecting it!
en.Photo4a: Your photosynthesis rate will always be highest when your sunlight meter and your water meter are both in the green zone.
en.Food1b: They show you how much food (sugar) you’ve produced.
en.Food1c: As your photosynthesis rate gets higher, your food builds up faster.
en.Food2a: Now take a few moments to experiment.
en.Food2b: Try moving in and out of the shadows and collecting some rain while watching how your meters behave.
en.Aphids1a: The insect on the platform is a giant mutant aphid!
en.Aphids1b: It likes to feed on the sugary sap of plants.
en.Aphids1c: If you let it touch you, it will steal some of your food and knock you back with mutant strength!
en.Aphids2c: Avoid it, or else jump on it to stun it.
en.Growth1b: Now we’ve seen how producing food through photosynthesis works.
en.Growth1c: But how do plants use their food to grow?
en.Growth2a: As we’ve already established, photosynthesis can only happen during the day.
en.Growth2b: However, the same is not true for plant growth!
en.Growth3a: Most plants grow fastest during the evening and night, using the sugar supply they built up throughout the day.
en.Growth4a: Soil contributes some important nutrients that are used in growth, as well as giving support to the plant.
en.Growth4b: However, the majority of the matter for growth originally comes from air and water.
en.Growth5a: If you weigh a pot of dry soil and then plant a seed in it, the weight of the soil will barely decrease by the time the seed has grown into a large plant!
en.Growth6a: Now let’s see your growth in action!
en.PreGame1: Now you’re prepared to start the game!
en.PreGame2: Starting at a height of 50mm, you will have from sunrise to sunset to use photosynthesis to produce food as quickly as you can, so that you can then grow as much as possible at night.
en.PreGame3: Play for multiple days and see how tall you can grow!
